definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The resolution was invalid because the shareholder's meeting was not quorate.
sentences.chinese: 因股东大会不够法定人数，故该决议无效。

sentences.english: The board meeting requires a quorum of over three quarter of the total number of directors.
sentences.chinese: 出席董事会会议的法定人数为全体董事的四分之三。

sentences.english: A quorum for a Nominated Jury is three, including its President.
sentences.chinese: 提名制评审团之法定人数为三位，包括评审团主席。

sentences.english: The meeting is adjourned since there is no quorum .
sentences.chinese: 因为没有法定人数会议休会。

sentences.english: A quorum for meetings of the Board shall be a majority of its members.
sentences.chinese: 理事会会议的法定人数应是其成员国半数以上。

sentences.english: Representatives of a simple majority of the members of the Technical Committee shall constitute a quorum.
sentences.chinese: 技术委员会成员简单多数的代表构成法定人数。

sentences.english: The number of initiators meets the quorum.

definition: competitive election (i.e. with more candidates than seats)
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
non-competitive election (i.e. with as many candidates as there are seats)/single-candidate election

pinyin: nian2 du4 gu3 dong1 da4 hui4

definition: seat in a parliament or legislative assembly
standing committee (e.g. of National People's Congress)
